H0.text: Become strong as it cures is the advantage that plasticity before concrete hardens allows the concrete to gain strength during the curing process.

H1.text: Withstand compression is an advantage because concreteâ€™s plasticity before it hardens allows the concrete to withstand compression.

H2.text: Remain pliable after hardening is an advantage because, before concrete has hardened, it exhibits plasticity, allowing the concrete to stay flexible after setting.

H3.text: Being molded into almost any shape is the advantage of concrete's plasticity before it hardens.

A4.text: The early strength of the concrete can be increased if it is kept damp during the curing process.

A5.text: Workability is the ability of a fresh (plastic) concrete mix to fill the form/mold properly with the desired work (pouring, pumping, spreading, tamping, vibration) and without reducing the concrete's quality.

A6.text: The concrete can be made into almost any shape and size for the construction industry.

A7.text: Since the concrete is always under compression, it is less subject to cracking and failure.
